clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility and Acceptability of Culturally Adapted Group Psychosocial Intervention for Depressed Fathers
clinical_study.official_title: A Group Parenting Intervention for Depressed Fathers (LTP+ Dads): A Feasibility Study From Pakistan

lead_sponsor.agency: Pakistan Institute of Living and Learning

clinical_study.source: Pakistan Institute of Living and Learning

brief_summary.textblock: The study is a feasibility trial with a pre and post-experiment design in Karachi, Pakistan's most populous city. The intervention comprises of twelve sessions of learning through play (LTP) plus during the three month period.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This integrated intervention is called LTP Plus Dads consisting of 10 group sessions delivered weekly by trained professionals who received weekly supervision by LTP Plus master trainers.

primary_outcome.description: Intervention feasibility tested by collating data on recruitment and retention rates. The success criterion of feasibility is to recruit > 50% of eligible fathers
Intervention acceptability assessed using data on attendance. Criterion for acceptability is a mean attendance rate of >70% of at least 5 sessions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in severity of symptoms measured using Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (Hamilton, 1960)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes in severity of symptoms from baseline to 3rd month
secondary_outcome.description: It is the most widely used clinician-administered depression assessment on a 3-point or 5-point Likert-type scale. Scoring is based on the 17-item scale and scores of 0-7 are considered as being normal, 8-16 suggest mild depression, 17-23 moderate depression and scores over 24 are indicative of severe depression; the maximum score being 52 on the 17-point scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in severity of symptoms measured using Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS; Cox et al. 1987),
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes in severity of symptoms from baseline to 3rd month
secondary_outcome.description: A widely used 10-item measure of postnatal depression that has been used with fathers in the postnatal period. The higher score shows high severity of depression.

arm_group.description: Participants in this group will receive 10 sessions of LTP plus dads

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Depressed fathers of children 0-30 months
- Given written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not willing to participate
- Out of trial catchment area
